question:
You are a math expert. When you respond, respond only with the Solution of the final Problem, thinking step by step. At the end of the Solution, when you give your final answer, write it in the form 'Final Answer: \\boxed{$answer$}. I hope it is correct.'
Kelly can read five pages of her fiction book or two pages of her history textbook in seven minutes. If Kelly wants to read thirty pages of each book, for how many minutes in total must Kelly read?
inference:
Fiction book pages per 7 minutes = 5 pages
History book pages per 7 minutes = 2 pages
Total pages to read = 30 (fiction) + 30 (history) = 60 pages

Fiction book time:
30 pages / 5 pages/7 minutes = 6 * 7 minutes = 42 minutes

History book time:
30 pages / 2 pages/7 minutes = 15 * 7 minutes = 105 minutes

Total time = 42 minutes + 105 minutes = 147 minutes

Final Answer: $\boxed{147}$ I hope it is correct.
ground_truth: Thirty pages of a fiction book is six sets of five pages, so it will take $6\times 7 = 42$ minutes to read the fiction book. Likewise, thirty pages of a history textbook is fifteen sets of two pages, so it will take $15\times 7 = 105$ minutes to read the history textbook. In total, this will be $42+105 = \boxed{147}$ minutes.
